designScenario.name: Advanced Cabin Temperature Control System
designScenario.description: A next-generation thermal management system utilizing predictive algorithms and zonal climate control to maintain optimal cabin conditions. Integrated with aircraft power management and flight phase awareness to balance passenger comfort with energy efficiency. Operates within aviation environmental control system (ECS) architecture while supporting emergency temperature protocols.

details.description: The system shall maintain cabin temperature between 16°C (61°F) and 28°C (82°F) with zonal control resolution of ±1°C per cabin section using variable-speed compressors and electric heating elements.
Shall achieve 90% deviation correction within 3 seconds for critical zones (flight deck/premium cabins) and 5 seconds for economy zones during normal operation.
Triple-redundant temperature sensors with voting logic and emergency ram air ventilation activation capability during total electrical failure.
Shall implement load-shedding algorithms reducing HVAC power consumption by 25% during takeoff/climb phases without perceptible comfort impact.

systemComponents.name: Thermal Management Unit
systemComponents.description: Central control unit integrating temperature regulation, airflow management, and power distribution for cabin climate systems

subComponents.name: Predictive Climate Processor
subComponents.description: AI-powered controller using flight phase data, passenger load, and external conditions to anticipate thermal demands

subComponents.name: Variable Refrigerant Flow Module
subComponents.description: High-efficiency heat pump system with inverter-driven compressors for precise temperature control

subComponents.name: Multi-Zone Infrared Sensor Array
subComponents.description: 16-point non-contact temperature monitoring system with passenger occupancy detection

systemComponents.name: Emergency Thermal Control
systemComponents.description: Backup system for smoke/fume purge and extreme temperature conditions

subComponents.name: Ram Air Ventilation Actuator
subComponents.description: Pneumatically-operated intake for emergency cooling during loss of electrical power

relationships.description: Receives real-time altitude and airspeed data for pressure-compensated temperature control
Emergency systems are integral components of the primary thermal management architecture
Requires 115V AC three-phase power with uninterrupted power supply (UPS) backup

attributes.name: operatingTemperatureRange
attributes.description: Extended operational envelope with frost prevention and hyperthermia protection modes

attributes.name: zonalControlResolution
attributes.description: Minimum temperature differential maintainable between adjacent cabin zones

attributes.name: emergencyCoolingRate
attributes.description: Minimum temperature reduction capability during smoke/fume emergency purge

attributes.name: sensorRefreshRate
attributes.description: Maximum interval between full-cabin temperature scans

attributes.name: powerEfficiency
attributes.description: Energy efficiency ratio during cruise phase operation
